question: 1)When is International Day of the World's Indigenous Peoples observed every year?
solution: --The United Nations' (UN) International Day of the World's Indigenous People is observed on August 9 each year to promote and protect the rights of the world's indigenous population.--On 23 December 1994, the United Nations General Assembly decided, in its resolution 49/214, that the International Day of the World's Indigenous People shall be observed on 9 August every year.--The date marks the day of the first meeting, in 1982, of the UN Working Group on Indigenous Populations.--This year's theme is COVID-19 and indigenous peoples' resilience.--It will focus on how preservation and promotion of indigenous peoples' traditional knowledge and practices.--Indigenous Peoples are culturally distinct societies and communities.--There are approximately 476 million Indigenous Peoples worldwide, in over 90 countries.

question: 2)In Aug 2020, which of the following companies has signed an MoU with the One District, One Product (ODOP) scheme of the Uttar Pradesh government?
solution: --E-commerce marketplace Flipkart has signed an MoU with the One District, One Product (ODOP) scheme of the Uttar Pradesh government to bring artisans, weavers and craftsmen into mainstream business.--The partnership will enable these under-served communities to showcase their specialised products and crafts to millions of customers across the country.--The initiative called `Flipkart Samarth` will enable them to break entry barriers by extending time-bound incubation support which includes benefits in the form of on-boarding, free cataloguing, marketing, account management, business insights and warehousing support.--The ODOP scheme was introduced to give a boost to the MSME sector while preserving and promoting the exquisite, indigenous legacy of art in Uttar Pradesh.--Flipkart has previously signed an MoU with the Uttar Pradesh Khadi and Village Industries Board to benefit weavers and artisans by introducing khadi fabrics and village industry products on the Flipkart marketplace.

question: 3)Which of the following NGOs has been selected as one of the ‘Top 10 Visionaries' in the world for the Food Vision 2050 Prize, announced in New York on August 6?
solution: --Rockefeller Foundation has selected Naandi Foundation, Hyderabad-based non-profit, as one of the ‘Top 10 Visionaries' in the world for the Food Vision 2050 Prize, announced in New York on August 6.--The recognition fetches Naandi a prize money of $200,000.--The award recognised the application of Arakunomics model in regions of Araku, Wardha and New Delhi, leading to the Food Vision 2050 that follows an “ABCDEFGH” framework centring on: Agriculture, Biology, Compost, Decentralised decision-making, Entrepreneurs, Families, Global Markets, and ‘Headstands', or turning current approaches on their head.-- Naandi's vision titled “Arakunomics” was based on work with tribal farmers in Araku for nearly 20 years.--Anand Mahindra (chairman, Mahindra Group) is the chair of the board of Naandi Foundation which comprises of Kris Gopalakrishnan (co-founder, Infosys Ltd.), Rajendra Prasad Maganti (chairman, Soma Enterprise Ltd.), and Satish Reddy (chairman, Dr Reddy's Laboratories Ltd.) as other members.--Established in 1998, it works in 19 States in India and has impacted seven million lives so far.

question: 4)Who among the following has authored the book titled ‘Amazing Ayodhya'?
solution: --The book titled ‘Amazing Ayodhya' has been written by Neena Rai.--Titled Amazing Ayodhya, the book by Neena Rai promises to offer “authentic information” about the city, which will not only help understand the life and times of ancient Hindus but also the revered figures of Rama and Sita.--According to the publishers, the book is replete with descriptions and draws out comparisons of an earlier era with our current life and culture, thus connecting the past with the present.

question: 5)In Aug 2020, which of the following states has launched a 'Mahila Evam Kishori Samman Yojana' to give free sanitary napkins to 22.50 lakh BPL women, girls?
solution: --The Haryana government launched a 'Mahila Evam Kishori Samman Yojana' to give free sanitary napkins to 22.50 lakh BPL women, girls.--Under the ‘Mahila Evam Kishori Samman Yojana', adolescent girls and women between 10 to 45 years of age of below poverty line (BPL) families would be provided free sanitary napkins every month for a year.--Apart from this, the Education Department has also prepared another scheme under which 6.50 lakh girl students would be provided six sanitary napkins every month.--The Haryana government also launched the ‘Mukhya Mantri Doodh Uphar Yojana' to provide fortified flavoured skimmed milk powder.--Under this scheme, around 200 ml of fragrant skimmed milk would be given per day for six days in a week to the children between 1 and 6 years of age in Anganwadi centres and pregnant and lactating mothers.

question: 6)In Aug 2020, which of the following states has decided to appoint over 6,000 community health officers under the National Health Mission?
solution: --Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has cleared a proposal for the appointment of 6,310 community health officers under the National Health Mission.--The recruitment on the post of community health officer will be done in all blocks of the state.--The chief minister also cleared several other proposals including the direct appointment of fourth-grade employees on 326 posts in the police department.--Rajasthan:--Capital: Jaipur--Chief Minister: Shri Ashok Gehlot--Governor: Kalraj Mishra--Formation: 30 March 1949--Number of Districts: 33.--Registered GI: Blue Pottery of Jaipur, Kathputlis, Sanganeri Hand-Block Printing.

question: 7)In Aug 2020, Andhra Pradesh government formed a six-member committee to reorganise districts. Who among the following has been appointed as the head of the committee?
solution: --Andhra Pradesh government formed a six-member committee to reorganise districts in the state from 13 to 25.--The state government formed a six-member committee headed by Chief Secretary Nilam Sawhney to study the various aspects related to the creation of 25 districts and measures to be taken to optimally utilise human and financial resources.--The panel was asked to submit a report within three months.--Chief Commissioner of Land Administration, General Administration Secretary (Services), Planning Secretary, a representative from the Chief Ministers Office will be members of the committee to study the restructuring of Districts in Andhra Pradesh.--while the Principal Finance Secretary will act as the Convener.

question: 8)In Aug 2020, who among the following has been appointed as the next Ambassador of India to the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan?
solution: --Shri Rudrendra Tandon has been appointed as the next Ambassador of India to the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan.--He is currently the Indian envoy to ASEAN at Jakarta.--Tandon replaces Vinay Kumar who has performed admirably with the withdrawal of US forces from Afghanistan after striking a deal with Taliban insurgents.--Afghanistan: --Capital - Kabul--Currency - Afghan afghani.--President - Ashraf Ghani.--National Sport - Buzkashi.

question: 9)In Aug 2020, which of the following has received clearance from UIDAI to carry out e-KYC authentication using Aadhaar?
solution: --Leading depository Central Depository Services Ltd (CDSL) has received clearance from UIDAI to carry out e-KYC authentication using Aadhaar.--The clearance has been obtained to act as a local Authentication User Agency (AUA) or e-KYC User Agency (KUA).--Once market intermediaries register as KUA, they can open accounts using Aadhaar-based e-KYC (electronic Know Your Customer).--CDSL will facilitate intermediaries to offer seamless online account opening using Aadhaar-based e-KYC.--The depository maintains and services over 2.4 crore Demat accounts of investors spread across the country.--In May, markets regulator Sebi had listed eight entities, including CDSL and CDSL Ventures, to undertake e-KYC Aadhaar authentication.

question: 10)In Aug 2020, which of the following companies has decided to acquire a 56% stake in CG Power?
solution: --Murugappa Group led Tube Investments of India Limited has decided to invest ₹700 crores in fraud-hit CG Power and Industrial Solutions Limited for 56% stake.--the two companies have reached a securities subscription agreement (SSA) which gives Tube Investments of India Limited control over 64.25 billion equity shares of face value of ₹2 each at a price of ₹8.56/- (including premium) per equity share aggregating to ₹550 crores.--This will give Tube Investments control over 50.62% of CG Power post the equity shares allotment.

question: 11)In Aug 2020, who among the following has been appointed as the managing director and chief executive of PNB Housing Finance?
solution: --PNB Housing Finance announced the appointment of Hardayal Prasad as its new managing director and chief executive.--The housing finance company promoted by country's second-largest state-owned Punjab National Bank (PNB) currently has Neeraj Vyas as its interim chief.--Vyas, the current interim managing director and chief executive officer of the company, will step down from the position on August 10.--Prasad is experienced in banking, international operations at SBI and SBI Cards and Payment Services (SBI Card).

question: 12)In Aug 2020, Minister of State for Railways Suresh Angadi inaugurated Malgudi Museum in which of the following states?
solution: --Minister of State for Railways Suresh Angadi inaugurated Malgudi Museum at Arasalu in Karantaka's Shivamogga.--The old station building at Arasalu has been converted into a museum.--The old station building at Arasalu has been renovated keeping with 'Malgudi' theme in mind.--It is a tribute to the makers of the popular television serial 'Malgudi Days' as the station features predominantly in the episodes which broadcast on Doordarshan in the 1980s.--The museum has been designed by a famous artist John Devraj, who was the part of the serial Malgudi Days. --The Mysore Divisional Railway funded the museum.

question: 13)In Aug 2020, which of the following states has signed an MoU with US-based IT firm the Boston Group to set up a facility devoted to research and development (R&D) in the IT sector?
solution: --The Andhra government signed an MoU with The Boston Group to set up a facility devoted to research and development (R&D) in the Information Technology sector.--The MoU was signed in the presence of Rathnakar Pandugayala, Special Representative to AP Government for North America and Subu Kota, the chairman of The Boston Group.--The move is expected to create over 250 jobs in the IT sector in Andhra.--Andhra government signed an MoU with US-based IT firm to setup centre at Visakhapatnam.
